dict.string: The Education Configuration Payload is designated by specifying com.apple.education as the PayloadType value. It can contain only one payload. The Education Configuration Payload defines the users, groups, and departments within an educational organization. It is supported on iOS 9.3 and later. On iOS, it must be supervised and sent over the device channel. It is supported on macOS 10.14 and later. On macOS, it must be sent over the user channel. Student payloads are only supported on macOS 10.14.4 and later.
Optional. A human-readable description of this payload. This description is shown on the Detail screen.
A human-readable name for the profile payload. This name is displayed on the Detail screen. It does not have to be unique.
A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited. Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier
A reverse-DNS-style identifier for the specific payload. It is usually the same identifier as the root-level PayloadIdentifier value with an additional component appended.
The type of the payload, a reverse dns string.
A globally unique identifier for the payload. The actual content is unimportant, but it must be globally unique. In macOS, you can use uuidgen to generate reasonable UUIDs.
The version of the whole configuration profile.

The version number of the individual payload. A profile can consist of payloads with different version numbers. For example, changes to the VPN software in iOS might introduce a new payload version to support additional features, but Mail payload versions would not necessarily change in the same release.
This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user.

Optional. A human-readable string containing the name of the organization that provided the profile. The payload organization for a payload need not match the payload organization in the enclosing profile.
Required. The organization's display name. This name will be shown in the iOS login screen.
All teacher and student devices that need to communicate with one another must have the same OrganizationUUID, particularly if they originated from different Device Enrollment Programs.

Required. The organization's UUID identifier. This can be any valid UUID. All teacher and student devices that need to communicate with one another must have the same OrganizationUUID, particularly if they originated from different Device Enrollment Programs.
Used to perform client authentication between devices.
Required. The UUID of an identity certificate payload that will be used to perform client authentication with other devices.

Shared: An array of dictionaries that define groups that the user can select in the login window. Leader: An array of dictionaries that define the groups that the user can control. Member: An array of dictionaries that define the groups of which the user is a member.

Required. Shared: An array of dictionaries that define groups that the user can select in the login window. Leader: An array of dictionaries that define the groups that the user can control. Member: An array of dictionaries that define the groups of which the user is a member.
Required. The unsigned 16 bit integer specifying this group's unique beacon ID.
Required. The display name of the group.
Deprecated in iOS 9.3.1 and later. URL of an image for the group.
Optional. The source that provided this group; e.g. iTunesU, SIS, or MDM.
Optional. The user identifiers that are leaders of this group.
Required. The strings that refer to entries in the Users array that are members of the group.
Required. The identifier strings that refer to entries in the DeviceGroups array that are device groups to which the instructor can assign users from this class.

Shared: An array of dictionaries that define the users that are shown in the iOS login window. Leader: An array of dictionaries that define users that are members of the leader始s groups. Member: An array of a dictionaries that must contain the definition of the user specified in the UserIdentifier key. With one-to-one member devices, this key should include only the device user and the leader but not other class members.

Required. Shared: An array of dictionaries that define the users that are shown in the iOS login window. Leader: An array of dictionaries that define users that are members of the leader始s groups. Member: An array of a dictionaries that must contain the definition of the user specified in the UserIdentifier key. With one-to-one member devices, this key should include only the device user and the leader but not other class members.
Required. The string that uniquely identifies a user in the organization.
Required. The string displayed as the name of the user.
Optional. The string displayed as the given name of the user.
Optional. The string displayed as the family name of the user.
Optional. The string that represents the user始s phonetic given name. It will be used to sort users in the Classroom app and the Shared iPad Login Screen.
Optional. The string that represents the user始s phonetic family name. It will be used to sort users in the Classroom app and the Shared iPad Login Screen.
URL pointing to a JPEG, PNG, or TIFF image of the user. Recommended either 256x256 or 512x512 resolution.

Optional. A string containing a URL pointing to an image of the user. This image will be displayed in the iOS login screen and in the Classroom app. The recommended resolution is 256 x 256 pixels (512 x 512 pixels on a 2x device). The recommended formats are JPEG, PNG, and TIFF. The ResourcePayloadCertificateUUID identity certificate or the MDM client identity will be used to perform authentication when fetching the image.

Deprecated in iOS 9.3.1 and later. URL pointing to an image of the user. The ResourcePayloadCertificateUUID identity certificate or the MDM client identity will be used to perform authentication when fetching the specified resource.
Optional. The Managed Apple ID for this user.
Optional. The passcode UI to show when the user is at the login window; possible values are complex, four, or six.

List of UUIDs referring to certificate payloads that will be used to authorize leader peer certificate identities. This array must contain all certificates needed to validate the entire chain of trust. Leader certificates must have the common name prefix leader (case insensitive) and have a .cer type.

Optional. An array of UUIDs referring to certificate payloads that will be used to authorize leader peer certificate identities. This array must contain all certificates needed to validate the entire chain of trust. Leader certificates must have the common name prefix leader (case insensitive) and have a .cer type.

List of UUIDs referring to certificate payloads that will be used to authorize group member peer certificate identities. This array must contain all certificates needed to validate the entire chain of trust. Member certificates must have the common name prefix member (case insensitive) and have a .cer type.

Optional. An array of UUIDs referring to certificate payloads that will be used to authorize group member peer certificate identities. This array must contain all certificates needed to validate the entire chain of trust. Member certificates must have the common name prefix member (case insensitive) and have a .cer type.

The UUID of an identity certificate payload that will be used to perform client authentication when fetching additional resources, such as, student images. If not specified the MDM client identity will be used.

Optional. The UUID of an identity certificate payload that will be used to perform client authentication when fetching additional resources, such as, student images. If not specified the MDM client identity will be used.
A unique string that identifies the user of this device within the organization.
Optional. A unique string that identifies the user of this device within the organization.
Shared: An array of dictionaries that define departments that are shown in the iOS login window.
Optional. Shared: An array of dictionaries that define departments that are shown in the iOS login window.
Required. The display name of the department.
Required. The group beacon identifiers that are members of this department.
Leader: An array of dictionaries that define the device groups to which the leader can assign devices. This key is not included in member payloads.
Optional. Leader: An array of dictionaries that define the device groups to which the leader can assign devices. This key is not included in member payloads.
Required. The string that uniquely identifies the device group in the organization.
Required. The string displayed as the name of the device group, which must be unique in the organization.
The strings containing the serial numbers of the devices in the group.
Required. The strings containing the serial numbers of the devices in the group.
To allow students enrolled in managed classes to modify teacher permission for screen observation, set to 'true'.
Optional. If set to true, students enrolled in managed classes can modify their teacher's permissions for screen observation on this device. Defaults to false.
Allow students to modify screen observation permissions
